page.title: 03PRIMARY EDUCATION-S.CREAKE
page.content: The area is served by a village primary school. The number of pupils is decreasing and in consequence the Education Authority has removed a teacher. The school has a headmaster, one teacher and a part-time welfare assistant for 46 pupils between the ages of 4 and 11 years. The Victorian building has detached toilets, causing problems in severe weather. Lunches are cooked in the kitchens of a school two miles distant and delivered by car in metal containers. It seems likely that in the future the school will be closed and children will be bussed to the modern County Primary School at Burnham Market, a distance of 4 miles away. This would be seen by many as contributing to the disintegration of village community life, but some parents feel their children would be receiving a better education elsewhere
